DataElement.preferredName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale Revised 3 Past Week How Often Had Trouble Keeping My Mind on What I Was Doing Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how often in the past week they had trouble keeping their mind on what they were doing, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale Past Week How Often Had Trouble Keeping My Mind on What I Was Doing Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-test that measures depressive feelings and behaviors within the general population._The most recent week, including today._A question about the frequency of an event or behavior._A question about whether an individual has or had trouble keeping their mind on what they were doing._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-test that measures depressive feelings and behaviors within the general population.

Concepts.longName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale
Concepts.definition: A self-test that measures depressive feelings and behaviors within the general population.

Property.preferredName: Past Week How Often Had Trouble Keeping My Mind on What I was Doing Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.:A question about whether an individual has or had trouble keeping their mind on what they were doing.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.

Concepts.longName: Had Trouble Keeping My Mind on What I was Doing
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has or had trouble keeping their mind on what they were doing.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: CES-D:Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale. Radloff, L.S., Applied Psychological Measurement, 1:385-401, 1977.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened nearly every day for two weeks.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened nearly every day for two weeks.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened between five and seven days.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened between five and seven days.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened on three or four days.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened on three or four days.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened on one or two days.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened on one or two days.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
